physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The right forearm was slightly larger than the left; no palpable masses, erythema, skin changes, or sensorimotor abnormalities were noted.
Histologic analysis confirmed a diagnosis of high-grade osteosarcoma arising in fibrous dysplasia; negative margins noted and tumor necrosis of 75%.

Radiograph showed a mixed lytic-sclerotic lesion of the right humeral neck, extending to the mid-diaphysis, along with smaller lesions in the glenoid and acromion; MRI revealed intramuscular masses presumed to be myxomas.
Mild pain and tenderness at the radiocapitellar joint observed; radiographs demonstrated some resorption of the graft proximally; radial head and hardware remained in good position.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: There has been some resorption of the graft proximally.
